column4: ok so i downloaded this ndiswrapper it opened a containing folder do i need like an unzip program or something?
i used the command you gave and it said it didn't exist...
what hardware are you using ndiswrapper for?
if it's for broadcom wireless, there are native drivers
I have a internal wirless card i am trying to get to connect to the internet so i don't have hard wire.
you dont have a hard wire at all?
i installed the bcx-fwcutter still nothing
do you have the windows driver on hand?
no i completely installed ubuntu so i have nothing.
fwcutter means "firmware cutter"...it pulls the firmware from your windows driver. if you were online with a wire when you installed it, it wouldve downloaded the driver and done it for you
i dunno where i would, or what it is at that.
go to the website of whatever company makes your computer, and get the wireless driver there. then someone can walk you through using fwcutter on it
if your still here, i have the drivers on my desktop they are .exe what's the next step?
this is where i stop, because i've never had to manually use fwcutter. i'm sure someone else here knows how to use it though
what is the question i should be asking?
